conclusion: Identify the inlets A, B, C, D with respective colors.
A: Green liquid from the top left.
B: Yellow liquid from the top right.
C: Blue liquid from the top center-right.
D: Light blue liquid from the top right.
A (Green) flows down past the green baffle likely to the bottom center.
B (Yellow) flows down directed by the yellow baffle towards the center.
C (Blue) flows downward guided by the blue baffle towards the bottom center.
D (Light Blue) flows down directed by the light blue baffle towards the center.
Baffles are positioned to guide the flow toward the bottom center.
All liquids are directed toward the center-bottom area where containers E and F are located.
E is on the left, F is on the right.
Liquid will likely flow into both E and F, primarily into E due to central alignment.
Liquid from A, B, C, and D will primarily flow into container E.
